item.title: Nobody Can Stop Facebook Because Nobody Understands Facebook
item.description: Mashablehas just published a post titled “Nobody Can Stop Facebook Because Nobody Understands Facebook“. There is an interesting sentence in this post: Have the nuances of online privacybecome so complex that they’re beyond the comprehension of mere mortals? I’m not saying that Facebookhas any intent to cause confusion, but the complexities of the open vs closed debateand the prescriptive vs descriptive nature of the “everybody” settingeffectively act to shut down public discourse.
